snippet: Permira and the Canada Pension Plan Investment Board are acquiring the enterprise software company in the biggest buyout of the year.
abstract: Enterprise software company Informatica will be taken private by Permira, private equity firm, and the Canada Pension Plan Investment Board; $5.3 billion deal is largest buyout so far in 2015; news sends Informatica shares up 4.3 percent.
lead_paragraph: Permira and the Canada Pension Plan Investment Board are acquiring the enterprise software company in the biggest buyout of the year.

headline.main: Canadian Pension Plan and Permira to Buy Informatica in $5.3 Billion Deal
headline.print_headline: Canadian Pension Plan and Permira to Buy Informatica in $5.3 Billion Deal
